isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - IC BUS SERVICE MANUAL - HEATERS AND ACCESSORIES - BLOWER ACCESS

svcprocinfo.para: Each blower motor has a resistor that controls the speed of the rotor.

The defroster/step heater switch is a three-speed switch with a three-post resistor. When checking for speed variation, check all three speeds. Use a multi-meter to check the resistor. Refer to the IC Bus Troubleshooting Guide.

svcsubproc.title: Auxiliary/Midship Heater Motor Access
svcsubproc.para: To gain access to the auxiliary heater motor or resistor, use the following steps.

step1.para: Locate the passenger seat above the heater.
Flip the seat cushion up by adjusting the seat clip.
Remove the heater cover panel screws in the center.
Remove the screws that secure the heater to the floor.
Pull the heater panels apart, exposing the internal parts.
Locate the heater motor and disconnect the wire leads from the resistor.
Remove the motor casing nuts that secure the motor to the shroud.
Remove the fan from the motor shaft by using a small Allen wrench and turning the set screw counter- clockwise.
To install, reverse the above steps.
